options.name: label
options.description:
Unique label for code cell. Used when other code needs to refer to the cell 
(e.g. for cross references `fig-samples` or `tbl-summary`)

options.name: classes
options.description: Classes to apply to cell container

options.name: eval
options.description: Evaluate code cells (if `false` just echos the code into output).

options.name: echo
options.description:
Include cell source code in rendered output. Specify `fenced` to include the cell delimiter 
as part of the output.

options.name: code-fold
options.description:
Collapse code into an HTML `<details>` tag so the user can display it on-demand.
Specify `show` to have the code initiallly visible.

options.name: code-summary
options.description: Summary text to use for code blocks collapsed using `code-fold`

options.name: code-overflow
options.description: Choose whether to `scroll` or `wrap` when code lines are too wide for their container.

options.name: code-line-numbers
options.description: Include line numbers in code block output.

options.name: lst-label
options.description: Unique label for code listing (used in cross references)

options.name: lst-cap
options.description: Caption for code listing

options.name: tidy
options.description: Whether to reformat R code.

options.name: tidy-opts
options.description: List of options to pass to `tidy` handler

options.name: collapse
options.description: Collapse all the source and output blocks from one code chunk into a single block

options.name: prompt
options.description:
Whether to add the prompt characters in R
code. See `prompt` and `continue` on the help page `?base::options`. Note
that adding prompts can make it difficult for readers to copy R code from
the output, so `prompt: false` may be a better choice. This option may not
work well when the `engine` is not `R`
([#1274](https://github.com/yihui/knitr/issues/1274)).

options.name: class-source
options.description: Class name(s) for source code blocks

options.name: attr-source
options.description: Attribute(s) for source code blocks

options.name: output
options.description: Include the results of executing the code in the output (specify `asis` to treat output as raw markdown with no enclosing containers).

options.name: warning
options.description: Including warnings in rendered output.

options.name: error
options.description:
Include errors in the output (note that this implies that errors executing code
will not halt processing of the document).

options.name: include
options.description: Catch all for preventing any output (code or results) from being included in output.

options.name: panel
options.description: Panel type for cell output (`tabset`, `input`, `sidebar`, `fill`, `center`)

options.name: message
options.description: Including messages in rendered output.

options.name: results
options.description:
How to display text results. Note that this option only applies to normal text output (not warnings,
messages, or errors). The possible values are as follows:

- `markup`: Mark up text output with the appropriate environments
  depending on the output format. For example, if the text
  output is a character string `"[1] 1 2 3"`, the actual output that
  **knitr** produces will be:

  ```` md
  ```
  [1] 1 2 3
  ```
  ````

  In this case, `results: markup` means to put the text output in fenced
  code blocks (```` ``` ````).

- `asis`: Write text output as-is, i.e., write the raw text results
  directly into the output document without any markups.

  ```` md
  ```{r}
  #| results: asis
  cat("I'm raw **Markdown** content.\n")
  ```
  ````

- `hold`: Hold all pieces of text output in a chunk and flush them to the
  end of the chunk.

- `hide` (or `false`): Hide text output.

options.name: comment
options.description:
Prefix to be added before each line of text output.
By default, the text output is commented out by `##`, so if
readers want to copy and run the source code from the output document, they
can select and copy everything from the chunk, since the text output is
masked in comments (and will be ignored when running the copied text). Set
`comment: ''` to remove the default `##`.

options.name: class-output
options.description: Class name(s) for text/console output

options.name: attr-output
options.description: Attribute(s) for text/console output

options.name: class-warning
options.description: Class name(s) for warning output

options.name: attr-warning
options.description: Attribute(s) for warning output

options.name: class-message
options.description: Class name(s) for message output

options.name: attr-message
options.description: Attribute(s) for message output

options.name: class-error
options.description: Class name(s) for error output

options.name: attr-error
options.description: Attribute(s) for error output

options.name: fig-width
options.description: Default width for figures

options.name: fig-height
options.description: Default height for figures

options.name: fig-cap
options.description: Figure caption

options.name: fig-subcap
options.description: Figure subcaptions

options.name: fig-link
options.description: Hyperlink target for the figure

options.name: fig-align
options.description: Horizontal alignment for the figure (`default`, `left`, `right`, or `center`)

options.name: fig-alt
options.description: Alternative text to be used in the `alt` attribute of HTML images.

options.name: fig-env
options.description: LaTeX environment for figure output

options.name: fig-pos
options.description: LaTeX figure position arrangement to be used in `\begin{figure}[]`.

options.name: fig-scap
options.description:
A short caption (only used in LaTeX output). A short caption is inserted in `\caption[]`, 
and usually displayed in the “List of Figures” of a PDF document.

options.name: fig-format
options.description: Default output format for figures (`retina`, `png`, `jpeg`, `svg`, or `pdf`)

options.name: fig-dpi
options.description: Default DPI for figures

options.name: out-width
options.description:
Width of the plot in the output document, which can be different from its physical `fig-width`,
i.e., plots can be scaled in the output document.
Depending on the output format, this option can take special values.
For example, for LaTeX output, it can be `.8\\linewidth`, `3in`, or `8cm`;
for HTML, it can be `300px`.

options.name: out-height
options.description:
Height of the plot in the output document, which can be different from its physical `fig-height`, 
i.e., plots can be scaled in the output document.
Depending on the output format, this option can take special values.
For example, for LaTeX output, it can be `3in`, or `8cm`;
for HTML, it can be `300px`.

options.name: fig-keep
options.description:
How plots in chunks should be kept. Possible values are as follows:

-   `high`: Only keep high-level plots (merge low-level changes into
    high-level plots).
-   `none`: Discard all plots.
-   `all`: Keep all plots (low-level plot changes may produce new plots).
-   `first`: Only keep the first plot.
-   `last`: Only keep the last plot.
-   If set to a numeric vector, the values are indices of (low-level) plots
    to keep.

options.name: fig-show
options.description:
How to show/arrange the plots. Possible values are as follows:

-   `asis`: Show plots exactly in places where they were generated (as if
    the code were run in an R terminal).
-   `hold`: Hold all plots and output them at the end of a code chunk.
-   `animate`: Concatenate all plots into an animation if there are multiple
    plots in a chunk.
-   `hide`: Generate plot files but hide them in the output document.

options.name: out-extra
options.description: Additional raw LaTeX or HTML options to be applied to figures

options.name: external
options.description: Externalize tikz graphics (pre-compile to PDF)

options.name: sanitize
options.description: sanitize tikz graphics (escape special LaTeX characters).

options.name: interval
options.description: Time interval (number of seconds) between animation frames.

options.name: aniopts
options.description:
Extra options for animations; see the documentation of the LaTeX [**animate**
package.](http://ctan.org/pkg/animate)

options.name: animation-hook
options.description:
Hook function to create animations in HTML output. 

The default hook (`ffmpeg`) uses FFmpeg to convert images to a WebM video.

Another hook function is `gifski` based on the
[**gifski**](https://cran.r-project.org/package=gifski) package to
create GIF animations.

options.name: tbl-cap
options.description: Table caption

options.name: tbl-subcap
options.description: Table subcaptions

options.name: layout
options.description:
2d-array of widths where the first dimension specifies columns and the second rows.

For example, to layout the first two output blocks side-by-side on the top with the third
block spanning the full width below, use `[[3,3], [1]]`.

Use negative values to create margin. For example, to create space between the 
output blocks in the top row of the previous example, use `[[3,-1, 3], [1]]`.

options.name: layout-ncol
options.description: Layout output blocks into columns

options.name: layout-nrow
options.description: Layout output blocks into rows

options.name: layout-align
options.description: Horizontal alignment for layout content (`default`, `left`, `right`, or `center`)

options.name: layout-valign
options.description: Vertical alignment for layout content (`default`, `top`, `center`, or `bottom`)

options.name: column
options.description: [Page column](https://quarto.org/docs/authoring/page-layout.html) for output

options.name: fig-column
options.description: [Page column](https://quarto.org/docs/authoring/page-layout.html) for figure output

options.name: tbl-column
options.description: [Page column](https://quarto.org/docs/authoring/page-layout.html) for table output

options.name: cap-location
options.description: Where to place figure and table captions (`top`, `bottom`, or `margin`)

options.name: fig-cap-location
options.description: Where to place figure captions (`top`, `bottom`, or `margin`)

options.name: tbl-cap-location
options.description: Where to place table captions (`top`, `bottom`, or `margin`)

options.name: cache
options.description:
Whether to cache a code chunk. When evaluating
code chunks for the second time, the cached chunks are skipped (unless they
have been modified), but the objects created in these chunks are loaded from
previously saved databases (`.rdb` and `.rdx` files), and these files are
saved when a chunk is evaluated for the first time, or when cached files are
not found (e.g., you may have removed them by hand). Note that the filename
consists of the chunk label with an MD5 digest of the R code and chunk
options of the code chunk, which means any changes in the chunk will produce
a different MD5 digest, and hence invalidate the cache.

options.name: cache-path
options.description: A prefix to be used to generate the paths of cache files

options.name: cache-vars
options.description:
Variable names to be saved in
the cache database. By default, all variables created in the current chunks
are identified and saved, but you may want to manually specify the variables
to be saved, because the automatic detection of variables may not be robust,
or you may want to save only a subset of variables.

options.name: cache-globals
options.description:
Variables names that are not created from the current chunk.

This option is mainly for `autodep: true` to work more precisely---a chunk
`B` depends on chunk `A` when any of `B`'s global variables are `A`'s local 
variables. In case the automatic detection of global variables in a chunk 
fails, you may manually specify the names of global variables via this option.
In addition, `cache-globals: false` means detecting all variables in a code
chunk, no matter if they are global or local variables.

options.name: cache-lazy
options.description:
Whether to `lazyLoad()` or directly `load()` objects. For very large objects, 
lazyloading may not work, so `cache-lazy: false` may be desirable (see
[#572](https://github.com/yihui/knitr/issues/572)).

options.name: cache-rebuild
options.description: Force rebuild of cache for chunk

options.name: cache-comments
options.description: Prevent comment changes from invalidating the cache for a chunk

options.name: dependson
options.description: Explicitly specify cache dependencies for this chunk (one or more chunk labels)

options.name: autodep
options.description: Detect cache dependencies automatically via usage of global variables

options.name: child
options.description: One or more paths of child documents to be knitted and input into the main document.

options.name: file
options.description: File containing code to execute for this chunk

options.name: code
options.description: String containing code to execute for this chunk

options.name: purl
options.description: Include chunk when extracting code with `knitr::purl()`
